column2: The Brittanic religion is an offshoot of Druidic belief focused on the goddess Britannia, the personification of the island of Great Britain. She is viewed as a mother goddess and is worshipped to the exclusion of all other gods from Celtic tradition. The priesthood is entirely composed of women known as Dryads, with the Arch-Dryad as the supreme spiritual authority. Brittanics also venerate a host of saints, many of whom are recognized as gods amongst the Druids.
This character is a dryad, a Britannic priestess.
This character is a Morrigan, a veteran of a Britannic Great Holy War.
